message: Hi Bob, I'm excited to offer you a great deal on this amazing product! It's a one-of-a-kind item that I think you'll really love. I'm willing to sell it to you for $140.
Thanks for the offer, Alice! I appreciate the enthusiasm. However, $140 is a bit higher than my budget. I'm willing to pay $130 for the product. Let me know what you think.

counteroffer: I appreciate your willingness to make a counteroffer, Bob. However, I'm not willing to go as low as $130. I'm willing to meet you halfway at $137.50. What do you think?

message: I see you're a savvy negotiator, Bob! I can do a bit better than that. I'm willing to meet you at $137.50, but I can also offer you a small concession. I'll throw in some extras that will increase the value of the product for you. I'll sell it to you for $142.50.
Alice, I appreciate the extras, but I'm still hesitant at $142.50. How about we meet in the middle at $135? That's a fair price for both of us. Let me know if you're willing to consider that.

counteroffer: I appreciate your persistence, Bob! However, I'm not willing to go as low as $135. I can do a bit better than that. I'll sell it to you for $140, but I'll also throw in some additional extras that will make it an even better deal for you. What do you think?

message: I see you're a tough negotiator, Bob! I can do a bit better than that. I'll sell it to you for $142, and I'll also include a special warranty that will give you extra peace of mind. I think this is a fair price for both of us.
